Definition 18.1. Area between curves.

Given that \(f(x)\) and \(g(x)\) are continuous and that \(f(x) \ge g(x)\) on the interval from \(x = a\) to \(x = b\text{,}\) the area between the curves \(f(x)\) and \(g(x)\) from \(x = a\) to \(x = b\) is given by

\begin{equation*} \int_a^b \Big(f(x) - g(x)\Big)\,dx \end{equation*}
